Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Perioperative Cardiovascular Risk Assessment

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were patients undergoing non-cardiac surgeries.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received the new guideline-based assessment, while the control group received standard care.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effectiveness of a new guideline for perioperative CV risk assessment in reducing complications.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of CV complications within 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised, with 100 in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 98 participants in the intervention group and 97 in the control group using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a significant reduction in CV complications (mean difference = 5.2%, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group, with mild gastrointestinal side-effects.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by the Brazilian Society of Cardiology.
